statement.tex: %text The angle of elevation of a hot air balloon climbing vertically changes from $30^\circ$ at $10$ AM to $60^\circ$ at ten minutes past $10$ AM. The point of observation is $300$ meters from the point of take off. What is the average upward speed of the plane? %

step.context: %text If O is the point of observation, A the takeoff point and B and C the balloon's positions at $10$ AM and $10:10$ AM respectively, does the following diagram depict the flight path of the balloon? %
step.reason: %text The balloon travels straight up, so the path of the balloon is along ABC and OA equals $300$ mts. %

step.context: %text Referring to the diagram in the prior step, if $\tan 30^\circ=\frac{BA}{OA}$, $\tan 60^\circ=\frac{CA}{OA}$ and $OA=300m$, what is length $BC$? %
%text If the balloon traversed $\dfrac{600}{\sqrt{3}}m$ in $10$ minutes, what is its speed in metres per second? %
